p: Identification of ocular surface cellular receptors utilized by respiratory viruses has provided information as to the permissiveness of ocular tissue to infection with these agents [ 6, 36]. Central to COVID-19 pathogenicity is that cellular entry is via the cell surface angiotensin converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor [ 37, 38]. It is the only mammalian group I coronavirus known to use ACE2 as its receptor [ 39]. ACE2 was previously identified as the receptor for SARS-Cov and NL63 [ 40]. Virus infectivity studies have shown that ACE2 is essential for SARS-CoV-2 to enter HeLa cells [ 41].
